sentence: She runs around the track every morning.
clue: To run means to move fast on your feet.

sentence: I read three books during the summer.
clue: To read means to look at words and understand them.

sentence: They opened the gift slowly and carefully.
clue: To open means to make something not closed.

sentence: He drew a picture of a dinosaur.
clue: To drew means to do something.

sentence: Please close the window before you leave.
clue: To close means to shut something.

sentence: The baby cried when the toy broke.
clue: To cry means to make tears when sad.

sentence: We waited for the bus in the rain.
clue: To wait means to stay until something happens.

sentence: I wrote a letter to my grandmother.
clue: To write means to put words on paper.

sentence: She drives to work every day.
clue: To drive means to control a car.

sentence: The students listened carefully to the teacher.
clue: To listen means to pay attention to sounds.
To eat means to put food in your mouth.

sentence: I found a shell on the beach.
clue: To find means to see something you were looking for.
To play means to have fun or join a game.
To break means to make something not work.

sentence: He helps his mom with the groceries.
clue: To help means to do something nice for someone.

sentence: I learned a new word today.
clue: To learn means to understand something new.
To jump means to go up into the air.

sentence: I sing in the school choir.
clue: To sing means to use your voice with music.

sentence: We watched a movie last night.
clue: To watch means to look at something for a time.

sentence: He sleeps with a nightlight on.
clue: To sleep means to rest your body and mind.

sentence: I drink orange juice in the morning.
clue: To drink means to put liquid in your mouth.
To paint means to put color on something.
To travel means to go to a new place.
To walk means to move with your feet.

sentence: He throws the ball very far.
clue: To throw means to push something through the air.

sentence: I run faster when it’s cold.
clue: To run means to move fast on your feet.

sentence: She fixes old furniture for fun.
clue: To fix means to make something work again.
To laugh means to make a happy sound when something is funny.

sentence: He teaches history at the college.
clue: To teach means to help someone learn.
To climb means to go up something.
To dance means to move to music.
To cook means to make food ready to eat.

sentence: I lost my favorite hat at the park.
clue: To lose means to not know where something is.

sentence: We win when we work as a team.
clue: To win means to be the best at something.
To build means to make something new.
To draw means to make pictures with a pen or pencil.
To open means to make something not closed.
To carry means to hold something and take it somewhere.

sentence: We swim in the lake every summer.
clue: To swim means to move through water.

sentence: He feeds the dog twice a day.
clue: To feed means to give food.
To watch means to look at something for a time.
To call means to talk to someone on the phone.
To follow means to go after someone or something.

sentence: He closes the gate behind him.
clue: To close means to make something shut.
To share means to let someone use something with you.

sentence: I startthe day with a smile.
clue: To start means to begin something.
To count means to say numbers in order.
To leave means to go away.
To hide means to go where no one can see you.

sentence: I catchthe ball with one hand.
clue: To catch means to take something that is moving.

sentence: They dig holes in the sand.
clue: To dig means to make a hole in the ground.
To ride means to sit on something that moves.
To drop means to let something fall.

sentence: He pushes the heavy door open.
clue: To push means to move something away from you.

sentence: We shout when we are excited.
clue: To shout means to speak very loudly.
To close means to make something shut.
To forget means to not remember.

sentence: I remember my first day of school.
clue: To remember means to keep something in your mind.

sentence: They move the chairs for the show.
clue: To move means to change place or position.
To draw means to make pictures with a pen or pencil.

sentence: He wears a hat every day.
clue: To wear means to have clothes on your body.

sentence: I bring snacks to the party.
clue: To bring means to take something with you.

sentence: We sit in a circle at story time.
clue: To sit means to rest on a chair or the ground.
To turn means to move around a point.
To find means to see something that was lost.

sentence: I clean my room every Friday.
clue: To clean means to make something not dirty.
To miss means to not catch or be too late.
To need means you must have something.
To get means to receive or take something.
To start means to begin.
To check means to look at something to be sure.
To send means to make something go to another place.
To answer means to say something after a question.
To turn means to move around a point.
To pull means to move something toward you.
